newsitem.title: USA: L.A. transit agency seeks fiber optic partnerships.
newsitem.headline: L.A. transit agency seeks fiber optic partnerships.

text.p: The Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Authority said on Thursday it was looking for partners to develop a county-wide fiber optics system along more than 300 miles of rail right-of-way.
The agency said it has asked telecommunications providers, public and private, to submit proposals for a fiber optics system that could expand data transmitting capacity.
"This will mean more jobs and business opportunities for the entire region," said Larry Zarian, the agency's chairman.
The agency said it was interested in proposals that would offer access points at all existing or planned rail stations and at key locations in undeveloped corridors.
The agency said it proposes to license right-of-ways, in exchange for a fee, or in partnership with a provider who can set up communications facilities needed by the agency.
Proposals must be delivered by December 20 and will be reviewed on a competitive basis. Final recommendations will be made to the agency's board at the February 1997 meeting.
